evaluation_summary: I chose Model A because it actually gave some depth to the answer while keeping the JSON structure clean. Model B is technically correct, but it's just too skimpy on the details to be truly useful. I should note that both models were smart enough to stay quiet and just output the code without adding any unnecessary 'Here is the JSON' chatter.

annotations.note: Followed the brief to the letter. It provided a rich, detailed JSON object without tripping up on the 'JSON only' constraint.
It's a pass, but it's very thin. It followed the rules, but it didn't give nearly as much value as Model A did.
